question: What A Level subjects do you offer?
Which subjects can my daughter take in Sixth Form?
A Level options at More House
answer: We offer a wide selection of A Level subjects at More House, designed to support each student’s strengths and aspirations. You can view the full list of available subjects on our [Academic Life page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/academic-life/). If you’d like to see our learning environment first-hand, our upcoming [Open Events page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/our-open-events/) has the latest details.

question: How do I apply for a place at More House?
What is the admissions process?
How can I register my daughter?
answer: To apply for a place at More House, please visit our [Admissions page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/), where you’ll find full details of our process. You can complete our online [registration form](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/register-your-daughter/) at any time. If you have any questions, I am always happy to help.

question: When are your open events?
How can I visit the school?
Do you offer tours or open mornings?
answer: We warmly invite families to visit us at one of our open events or to arrange a personal tour. Please see our [Open Events page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/our-open-events/) for the latest dates and booking information. If you’d prefer a private visit, just let me know and I will be glad to arrange it.

question: What are your fees?
How much does it cost to attend More House?
Can you provide information about school fees?
answer: Our current fees and full details of what is included can be found on our [Fees page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/fees-and-bursaries/). If you have any specific questions or wish to discuss fee assistance, please feel free to contact me directly.

question: Do you offer scholarships or bursaries?
What financial support is available?
Is there assistance with fees?
answer: Yes, we offer a number of scholarships and bursaries to support families. Full details, including eligibility and application information, can be found on our [Fees and Bursaries page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/fees-and-bursaries/). For advice or guidance, I am happy to help.

question: How do you support new pupils?
What transition support is in place?
Will my daughter settle in easily?
answer: We take great care to help every new pupil feel welcomed and supported. Our pastoral team, form tutors, and dedicated transition programme ensure that each girl is introduced to school life at her own pace. You can learn more about our approach on the [Pastoral Care page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/pastoral-care/).

question: What co-curricular activities do you offer?
Are there clubs and societies?
What can my daughter do outside lessons?
answer: More House offers a vibrant range of co-curricular clubs and activities, from creative arts and sport to STEM, debating, and music. This helps every girl to discover new interests and develop confidence beyond the classroom. Explore our [Co-Curricular page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/co-curricular/) for more details.

question: What support do you provide for university applications?
How do you help Sixth Formers with next steps?
Do you offer careers advice?
answer: We offer personalised careers advice and comprehensive support for university applications, including one-to-one guidance, interview preparation, and UCAS workshops. Read more about our approach on the [Sixth Form page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/sixth-form/) and [Academic Life page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/academic-life/).

question: Is there a school bus service?
How can my daughter travel to school?
Do you provide transport?
answer: We offer a variety of travel options for pupils, including school bus services and good public transport links. For more information, please visit our [Contact & Location page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/contact/) or get in touch if you would like to discuss your route.

question: Do you offer learning support or SEN provision?
What help is there for pupils with additional needs?
Can you tell me about your learning support?
answer: We provide a supportive environment for all pupils, with tailored learning support and SEN provision where needed. Our specialist team works closely with families to ensure every girl can thrive. Please see our [Pastoral Care page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/pastoral-care/) for further details, or contact me to discuss your daughter’s needs.

question: How big are your classes?
What is the average class size?
How many pupils per class?
answer: We believe small class sizes make a real difference to learning. This allows our teachers to know each pupil as an individual and offer the right level of challenge and support. More information about our academic approach can be found on our [Academic Life page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/academic-life/).

question: Do you offer sport and PE?
What sports can my daughter take part in?
How important is sport at More House?
answer: Sport and physical activity are central to life at More House. We offer a wide variety of sports for all ages and abilities, encouraging teamwork, resilience, and enjoyment. Visit our [Sport page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/co-curricular/sport/) to find out more.

question: How do you communicate with parents?
How will I receive updates?
Is there a parent portal or newsletter?
answer: We keep parents closely informed through regular newsletters, the parent portal, email updates, and meetings with staff. We also encourage open communication at any time—please feel free to get in touch whenever you have a question or concern.

question: What is your pastoral care like?
How do you look after pupils’ wellbeing?
Is support available if my daughter is struggling?
answer: Pastoral care is at the heart of everything we do. Each pupil is supported by her form tutor and our wider pastoral team, who work together to ensure every girl feels safe, valued, and able to thrive. Find out more on our [Pastoral Care page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/pastoral-care/).

question: What is your approach to homework?
How much homework do pupils get?
Is homework supported?
answer: Homework at More House is designed to reinforce classroom learning and encourage independent study skills. We aim to provide a balanced approach, with support available if your daughter needs it. If you’d like more details about our academic life, please see the [Academic Life page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/academic-life/).

question: Do you offer music or drama opportunities?
Are there concerts or performances?
How can my daughter get involved in the arts?
answer: Music and drama are a big part of life at More House. Pupils can join choirs, ensembles, productions, and individual lessons—whatever their interests or ability. You can find out more on our [Co-Curricular page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/co-curricular/), and I’m always happy to discuss your daughter’s interests.

question: Do you have before and after school care?
Is wraparound care available?
What are the hours for pupils?
answer: We offer flexible wraparound care to support busy families, with supervised sessions before and after school. If you’d like to discuss timings or arrangements, please contact me or visit our [Contact & Location page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/contact/).

question: What makes More House unique?
Why should I choose More House for my daughter?
What is special about your school?
answer: At More House, we pride ourselves on knowing every pupil as an individual and helping her to flourish—both academically and personally. Our strong sense of community and tailored opportunities mean each girl is supported to achieve her full potential. If you would like to discover our ethos, please visit our [About Us page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/about-us/).

question: Can my daughter join mid-year?
Do you accept in-year admissions?
Is there a waiting list?
answer: We welcome enquiries for mid-year or in-year admissions whenever places are available. If you would like to discuss your daughter’s situation, please contact me directly or visit our [Admissions page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/) for guidance.

question: How do I contact you for more information?
Who do I speak to about admissions?
Can I arrange a call or meeting?
answer: You are very welcome to contact me directly by phone or email—I am always happy to help with any questions about admissions or school life. You can also find our contact details and location on the [Contact & Location page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/contact/).

question: What are your entry requirements?
How do you assess applicants?
Is there an entrance exam?
answer: Entry requirements vary by year group, and we aim to make our process as supportive as possible. Details of our assessment and admissions process are available on the [Admissions page](https://www.morehouse.org.uk/admissions/). If you have specific questions, please do get in touch.
